case_vignette: a 48-year-old man is brought to the physician by his wife because he has become increasingly restless and anxious. his wife says that he has seemed sad and irritable for the past 4 months. he lost his job as a store clerk because he often lied to avoid work, and spent most of his days on the phone placing bets on football games. he avoids all family-related events because he has borrowed money from most of his relatives. he is hopeful that his symptoms will improve once he is able to win some of his money back. he previously smoked 8–10 cigarettes daily but quit 1 month ago. he drinks beer on the weekends. on examination, he is uncooperative and dismissive. he is mildly tremulous. neurologic examination is normal. he is oriented to person, place, and time.
question: which  is the most likely diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.

How long have you been experiencing these symptoms?
For the past 4 months.
Have you noticed any changes in your weight or appetite recently?
No, I have not mentioned any changes in my weight or appetite.

I haven't mentioned any family history of mental health issues.

No, I am not taking any medications or undergoing any treatment.

I haven't mentioned experiencing difficulty sleeping, concentration issues, or feelings of panic.
Have you experienced any recent major life changes or stressors?
Yes, I lost my job as a store clerk recently.
Final Diagnosis: Generalized Anxiety Disorder
